Topics include sampling methods, statistical treatment of data, gravimetric analysis, volumetric analysis, spectroscopy, chromatography, and electrochemical methods. Laboratory component provides hands on experience with analytical instruments and techniques. Emphasis is placed on accuracy, precision, and quality assurance in chemical analysis, COURSE OBJECTIVES 1. Apply statistical methods to analyze and interpret analytical data 2. Perform gravimetric analysis using precipitation and volatilization methods 3. Conduct volumetric titrations including acid base, redox, and complexometric titrations 4. Use spectroscopic techniques including UV Vis, IR, and atomic absorption spectroscopy 5. Perform chromatographic separations using GC, HPLC, and TLC 6. Apply electrochemical methods including potentiometry and voltammetry 7. Implement quality assurance and quality control procedures in analytical laboratories 8, Troubleshoot analytical methods and validate analytical procedures LITERATURE. 1 Quantitative Chemical Analysis" by Danie! Harris (10th Edition) 2 Analytical Chemistry’ by Gary Christian and Purnendu Dasgupta (7th Euition) 3. "Fundamentals of Analytical Chemistry” by Skoog, West, Holler, and Crouch (Sth Edition) 4.
